Selected Answer: AE
The correct answer is A. Dimensions and E. Grouping Function.

When creating Monitoring Query Language (MQL) expressions in the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Monitoring service, dimensions and grouping functions are optional components. You can create MQL expressions with or without specifying dimensions, and you can use grouping functions as needed, depending on your monitoring requirements.

So, both dimensions and grouping functions are optional when creating MQL expressions.

questions.question_text: Which TWO components are optional while creating the Monitoring Query Language (MQL) expressions in the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Monitoring service? (Choose two.)

You are backing up your on-premises data to the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Object Storage Service.
Your requirements are:
1. Backups need to be retained for at least full 31 days.
2. Data should be accessible immediately if and when needed after the backup.
Which OCI Object Storage tier is suitable for storing the backup to minimize cost?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
confirmed via documentation A

Selected Answer: D
confirmed via documentation D

Selected Answer: B
I will go for B. Infrequent Access Tier

The Infrequent Access tier is "cool" storage used for data that you access infrequently, but that must be available immediately when needed. Storage costs are less than Standard.

If you're uploading an object to a Standard default storage tier bucket, you can explicitly assign the object to the lower-cost Infrequent Access storage tier.

The Infrequent Access tier has a minimum storage retention period and data retrieval fees:

The minimum storage retention period for the Infrequent Access tier is 31 days. 

https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Object/Concepts/understandingstoragetiers.htm

Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is B
31 Days of minimum retention are on the definition of the Infrequent Access and inmediate availability too.

B is the correct answer:
https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Object/Concepts/understandingstoragetiers.htm#understandingobjectstoragetiers_topic-Infrequent_Access

The Infrequent Access tier is "cool" storage used for data that you access infrequently, but that must be available immediately when needed. Storage costs are lower than Standard.
The minimum storage retention period for the Infrequent Access tier is 31 days

Selected Answer: C
The most suitable OCI Object Storage tier for storing backups with the requirements of retaining data for at least 31 days and immediate accessibility when needed is the "Standard tier."

The Standard tier provides a good balance between cost, availability, and durability. It is designed for frequently accessed data and provides immediate access to your data when needed, making it suitable for backups that need to be readily accessible.

Option C, "Standard tier," is the correct choice for this scenario.

questions.question_text: What should be created before provisioning an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) DB System?

discussion.content: I agree with A. VCN, it is needed to be able to connect to the DB system
Remember you can still assign the database to a compartment in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) even after it has been provisioned

Selected Answer: A
While compartments (Option C) are also important for resource organization and access control, they are not directly related to the network configuration required for DB Systems.

Selected Answer: C
Compartment is correct, because we can use default VCN, but Compartment in OCI is must need to create before using any resource or service, thats why the billing cycle works.

Selected Answer: A
Before provisioning an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) DB System, you should create:

A. Virtual Cloud Network (VCN)

A Virtual Cloud Network (VCN) is a fundamental component of Oracle Cloud Infrastructure that provides a customizable and private network environment for your resources. When you provision a DB System, you typically want it to be deployed within a specific VCN to control its network configuration and access.

So, the correct answer is A. Virtual Cloud Network.
Ã€ is correct

https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/dbcs/doc/create-db-system-using-console.html
Compartment - for your new DB system
the VCN in which to create the DB system. Click Change compartment to select a VCN in a different compartment.
A is the rigth answer because, by default all tenant as already a root compartment which can be used, but the VCN must be create before creation DBCS instance.
to exam topic please share the reference why compartment is correct answer but not VCN

Selected Answer: A
Compartment is NOT mandatory as we can also use root compartment which is created by default. 
- A correctly configured virtual cloud network (VCN) to launch the DB system. Its related networking resources (gateways, route tables, security lists, DNS, and so on) must also be configured as necessary.

questions.question_text:
The volume of transactions of your rental business is increasing. You anticipate a rise in workload during the upcoming holiday sales event. You want to ensure that the business is not impacted during the event due to an overloaded database system. Based on your database administrator's suggestion, you intend to scale up your Virtual Machine DB System during the event period to address the resource demand.
Which of the following TWO statements are true about scaling the Virtual Machine DB System? (Choose two.)

Your IT team has asked you to provision an Autonomous Database in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI), but they want it to operate similar to what you have currently on-premises.
What are the TWO prerequisites for successfully deploying an Autonomous Dedicated Database in OCI? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
confirmed via documentation A

Selected Answer: C
confirmed via documentation C

Selected Answer: AD
The correct prerequisites for successfully deploying an Autonomous Dedicated Database in OCI are:

A. Exadata Infrastructure: Autonomous Dedicated Databases are deployed on dedicated Exadata infrastructure, which provides high performance and isolation.

D. Autonomous Container Database: You need an Autonomous Container Database within the Autonomous Dedicated Database service to host one or more Autonomous Databases.

Selected Answer: AD
A and D are related to DB
